trans-unit.source: Represents Entity Framework-related errors that occur in the <xref uid="langword_csharp_EntityClient" name="EntityClient" href=""></xref> namespace.

The <xref uid="langword_csharp_EntityException" name="EntityException" href=""></xref> is the base class for all Entity Framework exceptions thrown by the <xref uid="langword_csharp_EntityClient" name="EntityClient" href=""></xref>.
For more information about how to handle code exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.EntityException"></xref> class.
For more information about how to handle code exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.EntityException"></xref> class.
For more information about how to handle code exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception>.
The message that describes the error.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.EntityException"></xref> class.
For more information about how to handle code exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception>.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.EntityException"></xref> class.
For more information about how to handle code exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception>.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

The exception that caused the current exception, or a <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.
